text: New Light: The Birth of a King

\f + \fr 9:1 \ft \xt Isaiah 9:1–21 \ft in the English Bible is 8:23–9:20 in the Hebrew Bible \f* ⸤But there will be no gloom for those who were in distress⸥.\f + \fr 9:1 \ft Literally “Indeed there is no gloom for the one to whom there was anxiety for her” \f*

In former times he\f + \fr 9:1 \ft That is, Yahweh \f* treated \add the\add* land of Zebulun and Naphtali with contempt, but in the future he will honor the way of the sea beyond the Jordan, Galilee \add of\add* the nations.
The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light;
light has shined on those who lived in a land of darkness.
You have made the nation numerous;
you have not\f + \fr 9:3 \ft The written text (\fqa Kethib \ft ) is “not,” but the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) is “for it” \f* made the joy great.
They rejoice in your presence as \add with\add* joy at the harvest,
as they rejoice when they divide plunder.
For you have shattered the yoke of its burden
and the stick of its shoulder,
the rod of its oppressor, on\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Hebrew “like”; the Hebrew letters for “like” and “on” look alike \f* the day of Midian.
For every boot ⸤that marches and shakes the earth⸥\f + \fr 9:5 \ft Literally “marching with shaking,” which might mean “marching \fq is \ft with shaking” \f*
and garment rolled in blood
⸤will⸥\f + \fr 9:5 \ft Literally “and it will” \f* be for burning—fire fuel.
For a child has been born for us;
a son has been given to us.
And the dominion will be on his shoulder,
and his name is called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God,
Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
⸤His dominion will grow continually,
and to peace there will be no end⸥\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Literally “There is no end to the increase of the dominion and to peace” \f*
on\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Or “for” \f* the throne of David and over\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Or “for” \f* his kingdom,
to establish it\f + \fr 9:7 \ft That is, the kingdom \f* and sustain it
with justice and righteousness
now and forever.
The zeal of Yahweh of hosts will do this.
Yahweh’s Anger against Arrogance
The Lord has sent out a word against Jacob,
and it fell on Israel.
And all of the people knew it,
Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria
in pride and arrogance of heart, saying,
“\add The\add* bricks have fallen, but we will build \add with\add* dressed stone.
\add The\add* sycamore-fig trees were felled, but we will replace \add them with\add* cedars.”
So Yahweh strengthened ⸤the adversaries of Rezin⸥\f + \fr 9:11 \ft Or “his adversaries” if a copyist added “of Rezin” in error \f* against him,
and he provoked his enemies—
Aram from \add the\add* east
and Philistines\f + \fr 9:12 \ft Hebrew “Philistine” \f* from \add the\add* west—
and they devoured Israel with the whole mouth.
He has not turned away his anger in all of this,
and his hand is still stretched out.
And the people did not turn to the one who struck it,\f + \fr 9:13 \ft That is, the people \f*
and they did not seek Yahweh of hosts.
So Yahweh cut off head and tail from Israel,
palm branch and reed \add in\add* one day.
Elders\f + \fr 9:15 \ft Hebrew “Elder” \f* and ⸤the respectable⸥\f + \fr 9:15 \ft Literally “one lifted up of face” \f* \add are\add* the head,
and prophets\f + \fr 9:15 \ft Hebrew “prophet” \f* who teach lies\f + \fr 9:15 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f* \add are\add* the tail.
And the leaders of this people were misleading \add them\add*,
and those who were led \add were\add* confused.
Therefore the Lord did not rejoice over its young men,
and he did not have compassion on its orphans and widows,
for everyone \add was\add* godless and an evildoer,
and every mouth \add was\add* speaking folly.
In all of this his anger did not turn away,
and still his hand \add is\add* stretched out.
For wickedness burned like fire;
it consumed brier and thorn.
And it kindled the thickets of the forest,
and they swirled upward \add in\add* a column of smoke.
The land was burned through the wrath of Yahweh of hosts,
and the people became like fire fuel.
⸤People had no compassion toward each other⸥.\f + \fr 9:19 \ft Literally “A man does not have compassion toward his brother” \f*
They devoured on \add the\add* right but \add still\add* were hungry
and devoured on \add the\add* left but they were not satisfied.
Each one devoured the flesh of his arm,
Manasseh \add devoured\add* Ephraim, and Ephraim Manasseh;
together they \add were\add* against Judah.
In all of this his anger has not turned away,
and still his hand \add is\add* stretched out.
